c74object.name: fl.prioritise~
c74object.digest: Apply a fixed priority ranking to synchronous input frames
c74object.description: Frames arriving asynchronously are sent to the output. When frames arrive synchronously only one is sent to the output. The input number is used to proritise synchonous inputs. Either higher or lower numbered inputs can be prioritised.

entry.name: /order [instantiation enum]
entry.description:
Set whether to prioritise lower or higher numbered inputs.
[0] - low[1] - high

objarg.name: num_ins
objarg.description:
This argument sets the num_ins parameter:
Sets the number of inputs.

objarg.name: order
objarg.digest: Set whether to prioritise lower or higher numbered inputs
objarg.description:
This argument sets the order parameter:
Set whether to prioritise lower or higher numbered inputs.
[0] - low[1] - high

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.prioritise~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else, a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

method.name: frame
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

method.name: sync
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.prioritise~. When set to 0 fl.prioritise~ can form part of a non-realtime network for processing in message threads, using buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.prioritise~.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
